Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Robinson’s last encampment was swept about a month ago, and “nearly everything” was taken, including his state ID card, he said.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: The 38-year-old had chosen to set up camp near Palou Ave. and Griffith St. in Hunters Point, on a dead-end road surrounded by industrial buildings.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Despite Public Works’ policy and procedure for documenting, bagging, and tagging most belongings, Robinson said he was unable to find any of his property at the city’s mandated storage facility at 2323 Cesar Chavez St.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: The 38-year-old had chosen to set up camp near Palou Ave. and Griffith St. in Hunters Point, on a dead-end road surrounded by industrial buildings.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: According to Mayor London Breed, the intention is to clean up sidewalks and force unhoused people into the city’s labyrinthine network of shelter and supportive housing programs.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: She is the mayor of San Francisco and is responsible for the city's policies on encampment sweeps.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: A federal survey released in May counted more than 8,000 unhoused people in the city, which has fewer than 4,000 shelter beds to offer.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: It provides data on the unhoused population and shelter capacity in San Francisco.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: According to Public Works policy, staff are supposed to provide the resident of an encampment a “reasonable amount of time (approximately 30 minutes)” to sort through and collect their belongings before the camp is torn down.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: It outlines the official procedures for encampment sweeps in San Francisco.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: He was neither detained nor cited for illegal lodging, and told Gazetteer he had spoken to a member of the “Encampment Resolution Team,” who offered temporary shelter. Robinson did not accept it.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: The 38-year-old had chosen to set up camp near Palou Ave. and Griffith St. in Hunters Point, on a dead-end road surrounded by industrial buildings.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: “All they do is tell me to go back to the Hunters Point Navigation Center. And I don’t want to do that. I had bad experiences,” he said.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: The 38-year-old had chosen to set up camp near Palou Ave. and Griffith St. in Hunters Point, on a dead-end road surrounded by industrial buildings.
Joey O’Brien, 46, tried to explain to police officers that he was camping on the sidewalk in Hunters Point while investigating a homicide that occurred while he was in jail.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: O’Brien was polite and contrite, admitting that he had broken several windows in the past while suffering a mental breakdown.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Joey O’Brien, 46, tried to explain to police officers that he was camping on the sidewalk in Hunters Point while investigating a homicide that occurred while he was in jail.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: More than anything, however, he begged for officers to bring over his two neat backpacks, which had his best clothes, documents, and “bits of silver.”
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Joey O’Brien, 46, tried to explain to police officers that he was camping on the sidewalk in Hunters Point while investigating a homicide that occurred while he was in jail.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: “The other stuff is under all that over there,” the officer said with a shrug. “You’re going to have to pick it up later.”
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: The officer was part of the team detaining O'Brien and handling his belongings during the sweep.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: as a recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams shows, Public Works has bagged medications, wheelchairs, and even a mobility walker from unhoused people, taking them to the city’s storage facility on Cesar Chavez St.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: The records were secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams and provide evidence of belongings taken during sweeps.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Many unhoused people, including Robinson, say it can be challenging to identify and retrieve their belongings at the facility.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: They are directly affected by the sweeps and have experienced challenges retrieving belongings.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: In a response to Gazetteer's questions about potential breaches in protocol, Public Works spokesperson Rachel Gordon only noted that "the policy clearly spells out how soiled items can be handled and our crews follow the policy and consistently apply its terms." Gordon said claims for lost property can be filed with the City Attorney's office.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: She is the official spokesperson for Public Works, responding to questions about sweep protocols.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Instead, the city swooped down on the encampments at Sixth and Jessie streets earlier than scheduled, said Julian Highsmith, communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness.
Sourcing Table.Title of Source: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: He is the communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness, an advocacy group opposing the sweeps.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: “Typically, with city sweeps, they give 72 hours of notice with location and time, and we were following that, but they didn’t follow that usual rule,” Highsmith said.
Sourcing Table.Title of Source: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: He is the communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness, an advocacy group opposing the sweeps.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Highsmith told Gazetteer he believes the city may have gotten wind of the group’s planned sweep disruption and undercut it in order to prevent unhoused people from organizing with their advocates during an enforcement.
Sourcing Table.Title of Source: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: He is the communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness, an advocacy group opposing the sweeps.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: “I personally think it’s a little suspicious to do the sweep earlier. It doesn’t seem like the city wants attention on the encampment sweeps, and I don’t think they want people to see what happens during that process,” he said.
Sourcing Table.Title of Source: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: He is the communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness, an advocacy group opposing the sweeps.
